New Records: Canada won their first match at any Twenty20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Canada stunned Ireland by 12 runs in a Group A game in New York.
Shreyas Movva contributed 37 runs in 36 deliveries.
Jeremy Gordon took 2 wickets for 16 runs.
Dillon Heyliger took 2 wickets for 18 runs.
George Dockrell and Mark Adair had a partnership of 62 runs for Ireland.
Jeremy Gordon took the catch to dismiss Mark Adair off his own bowling.
Craig Young impressed early on with 2 wickets for 32 runs.
Mark Adair dismissed Navneet Dhaliwal, who had scored a half-century in the tournament opener against USA.
Junaid Siddiqui caught and bowled Andrew Balbirnie.
Saad Bin Zafar bowled Harry Tector for 7.
Curtis Campher and Gareth Delany were dismissed by Dillon Heyliger.
Pre-Game Insights: The focus was on the pitches at the Nassau County International Cricket Stadium due to uneven bounce and movement in earlier matches.
The curators improved the pitch conditions by shaving off the grass and rolling it multiple times.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch played much better, allowing batters to perform without getting hit.
This was the second time in two days that an associate team stunned a full member nation, following USA's victory over Pakistan.
